text: Approved submittals for piping, fittings, valves, insulation, and fixtures received and stamped
Plumbing drawings coordinated with structural and architectural (penetrations, slopes, fixture locations)
Code compliance verified: NPC, local AHJ amendments, backflow prevention, insulation R-values
Pipe routing and slope per NPC and design (2% minimum slope for drainage, per code)
Cold and hot water pipes tested to minimum 100 psi for 2 hours, no leakage
DWV tested with air (5 psi for 15 min) or water (10’ head for 15 min)
Vents installed at all required locations with proper offsets and above flood rim
Backflow preventers and isolation valves installed at designated risers or mechanical rooms
Firestopping of penetrations installed and labeled
Fixtures installed level, anchored, and piped with approved materials and escutcheons
Mixing valves, temperature limiters, and shutoffs installed per drawing
Drainage connections properly vented and air gaps provided for indirect connections (e.g., dishwasher, ice maker)
Hot water recirculation installed (if applicable) and flow verified
All valves, drains, and hose bibbs labeled and tagged
All systems flushed, chlorinated (potable), and certified
Fixture operation tested (fill/drain, flush, leak check) and clean
As-built drawings submitted, O&M manuals turned over
Final inspection passed by AHJ and certificate issued
